As an AI language model, I do not have personal views or opinions. However, I can provide information and insights. 

Yes, the globalization of media has influenced the language used by announcers. Announcers are now using language that is more simplified and clear to accommodate non-native speakers. With the rise in digital technology and social media, information is spreading fast, and it is now possible to communicate messages to a global audience. To ensure that their message is understood by a diverse audience, announcers are now simplifying their language by limiting the use of technical terms and industry jargon.

Moreover, announcers are also making an effort to use plain language and avoid colloquialisms or regional accents that may be difficult for non-native speakers to understand. Additionally, some announcers may provide translations or subtitles to help non-native speakers better understand the content.

In conclusion, the globalization of media has influenced the language used by announcers, with simpler language being used to accommodate non-native speakers. This is important to ensure that the message is understood by a diverse audience and to enhance effective communication.
